intro: Piptocarpha vauthieriana, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has linear, gray-green leaves and produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Piptocarpha vauthieriana plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
